name: LivePreview Digital Product Demo Bar for WordPress
author: Avirtum

sections.description:
LivePreview is a WordPress plugin that lets you manage and switch between your digital products like HTML themes & templates, HTML5 games and etc. The script include a responsive test tool inside the demobar, switch panel with thumbnails of the products, buttons for different actions (buy, download, iframe close). The plugin can be deployed easily. It runs on all modern browsers and mobile devices like iOS, Android and Windows.

This is the LITE version of the official LivePreview – Digital Product Demo Bar for WordPress plugin which comes with support and doesn’t have some limitations. You can get it by visiting the CodeCanyon website and buy the pro version.

The sample of how to create a livepreview item

Features

  • Powerful Interface – many options & capabilities
  • 3 Predefined Themes – included 2 skins: top & bottom (you can add your own)
  • Responsive – test your theme with different screen sizes
  • AJAX saving – save your config without page reloading
  • Customization – create you own theme

The developer version is available here.
sections.installation:
• From the WP admin panel, click “Plugins” -> “Add new”
  • In the browser input box, type “LivePreview”
  • Select the “LivePreview” plugin and click “Install”
  • Activate the plugin

Alternatively, you can manually upload the plugin to your wp-content/plugins directory
sections.faq:
I’d like access to more features and support. How can I get them?

You can get access to more features and support by visiting the CodeCanyon website and buy the pro version. Purchasing the plugin gets you access to the full version of the LivePreview plugin, automatic updates and support.

What is the difference between Lite and PRO

The lite version has only one limits:
1) You can create and use only 3 items
2) You can’t save & load config from a json file
All other features are the same as PRO has.
sections.changelog:
1.2.3

  • New – search function is based on the item title & tag

1.2.2

  • Fix – filter products on frontend

1.2.1

  • Fix – can’t slide the site up or down on Safari 13 and above

1.2.0

  • New – frontend is independent of WordPress themes and third-party plugins
  • New – customize the text for the buy button
  • New – the ability to select a “default” responsive device

1.1.0

  • New – enable/disable the main preload overlay
  • New – set logo URL (open in a new or self window)
  • New – enable/disable the product list

1.0.3

  • New – field for the product ID, each item can have a unique URL
  • New – work with the browser history
  • New – list navigation with arrow keys (up & down)
  • New – move a product item to the start or end of the list

1.0.2

  • New – light theme

1.0.1

  • Fix – can’t slide the site up or down on Safari 12

1.0.0

  • Initial release
